title: Wheelchair fitness: Surviving coronavirus lockdown on wheels
description: The BBC’s Frank Gardner shows how he’s keeping fit during the UK's coronavirus lockdown measures.

title: Coronavirus: William and Kate video call key workers' children
description: The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge chatted to pupils and thanked teachers at a Lancashire school.

title: Coronavirus: 'We need to recruit hundreds more live-in carers'
description: The CEO of a social care firm says there is a surge in demand for live-in carers due to coronavirus.

title: Coronavirus crisis forces farmers to throw milk away
description: Some dairy farmers are throwing away thousands of litres amid supply chain disruption due to coronavirus.

title: Coronavirus: Will summer make a difference?
description: Other coronaviruses are sensitive to the seasons.

title: Will we ever take cruise holidays again?
description: The cruise line industry faces a long journey back from the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Virtual pub quiz: How to run one that's actually good
description: Eggheads quizmaster Jeremy Vine is here to improve your quizzing.

title: Coronavirus: How Russia's ballet wasn't shut down despite lockdown
description: The spread of coronavirus has shut down entertainment venues but for these dancers the show must go on.

title: What was the best year for music?
description: Was 1984 more influential than 1982? Streaming statistics from the BPI suggest it might have been.

title: Coronavirus: ‘We won’t get a refund on our £17,000 chalet’
description: Holidaymakers say they are struggling to get refunds on cancelled holidays due to the lockdown.

title: Premier League players launch initiative to help NHS
description: Premier League players launch a "collective initiative" to help generate funds for the National Health Service

title: Coronavirus: How England lags behind other UK nations on testing
description: Official data suggests testing in England has been slower than in Scotland Wales and Northern Ireland.

title: Coronavirus: Transport workers 'must not work' without measures
description: The union's advice follows the deaths of 14 workers in London and others elsewhere in the UK.

title: US election 2020: Bernie Sanders suspends presidential campaign
description: The decision clears the way for Joe Biden to become the Democratic candidate in the 2020 election.

title: Coronavirus: Boris Johnson 'responding to treatment' in intensive care
description: Boris Johnson continues to be treated for coronavirus - as a review of UK lockdown rules could be delayed.

title: The Jewish Chronicle and Jewish News to go into liquidation
description: The Jewish Chronicle and Jewish News say they cannot survive the impact of the coronavirus epidemic.

title: Essex lorry deaths: Driver Maurice Robinson admits manslaughter
description: Maurice Robinson was arrested after the bodies of 39 Vietnamese migrants were found in his lorry.

title: County players agree 'support package' - including pay cuts - to help game
description: County champions Essex are among clubs to put players on furlough after a "support package" is agreed to help the first-class game.

title: Coronavirus: Lockdown in Wales to be extended next week
description: The lockdown will not be lifted next week, Wales' first minister confirms.

title: Coronavirus: Trump attacks 'China-centric' WHO over global pandemic
description: The president says the US may withdraw funding to the World Health Organization for "calling it wrong".

title: Coronavirus: Wills 'being signed on car bonnets' amid lockdown
description: Solicitors see a "massive rise" in demand but the need for two witnesses creates practical difficulties.

title: Coronavirus: Woodbridge residents do daily social distancing dance
description: Warwick Avenue comes alive at 11am every day with residents dancing on their drives.

title: Coronavirus: Fifteen die in care home during pandemic
description: The people were residents at a 69-bed care home in Luton.

title: Kazakh family win Unexplained Wealth Order battle over London homes
description: A High Court judge overturns an order to seize three multimillion-pound London homes.

title: Premiership season delayed 'until safe to resume'
description: Premiership Rugby is exploring the possibility of rescheduling the Twickenham final after further postponing the season.

title: World Championships moved to avoid 2022 Commonwealths clash
description: The 2022 World Athletics Championships is moved forward by three weeks to avoid a clash with the Birmingham Commonwealth Games.

title: Coronavirus: Covid-19 detecting apps face teething problems
description: Researchers at two leading universities take different approaches to creating cough-analysing tools.

title: 'My 98-year-old mum recovered from coronavirus'
description: The Perthshire pensioner's son praises "unbelievable" NHS workers during her stay in hospital.

title: Coronavirus: NHS heroes 'are like WW2 Spitfire pilots'
description: Hylton Murray-Philipson hails medics after Covid-19 had left him "reduced to the state of a baby".

title: 'Dancing' mice spotted on quiet Tube platform
description: The two rodents were filmed at London's Notting Hill Gate station on Monday night.

title: Clubs to vote on SPFL season plan - but Scottish Premiership decision delayed
description: SPFL clubs will vote this week on whether the Scottish Championship, League One and League Two seasons should be ended - but a decision over the outcome of the Premiership has been delayed.

title: Coronavirus: Are dentists open during the lockdown?
description: The British Dental Association says dentists are being bombarded by calls from patients in pain.

title: Coronavirus: Tesco tells people to visit stores to get food
description: The supermarket says there is "simply not enough capacity" to supply everyone with online shopping.

title: World's steepest street: Harlech loses title to New Zealand
description: Records book bosses change their mind and give the record back to a town in New Zealand.

title: Killing Eve: Third season divides critics
description: Reviewers are in two minds about the third season of the BBC's darkly comic thriller.

title: Match of the Day: Top 10 podcast - Premier League managers
description: Our Match of the Day pundits discuss just who is the best ever Premier League manager?

title: Alan Shearer: ‘Let Premier League players decide the best way to help’
description: Premier League players will want to play their part in the fight against the financial effects of coronavirus, says Alan Shearer.

title: Coronavirus: Wuhan emerges from the harshest of lockdowns
description: As Wuhan lifts its severe lockdown, there is anger, relief and even defiance from some residents.
